trans-unit.source: Snapshot Blob
trans-unit.target: Snapshot Blob

trans-unit.source: Snapshot Blob
trans-unit.target: Snapshot Blob

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a read-only snapshot of a blob.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a read-only snapshot of a blob.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.source: PUT Method Request URI
trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Emulated Storage Service URI
trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service URI

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated account name:

trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.
trans-unit.target: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob.

trans-unit.source: If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the base blob metadata to the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the base blob metadata to the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the snapshot is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the base blob.
trans-unit.target: If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the snapshot is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the base blob.

trans-unit.source: Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Containers and Blobs</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Containers and Blobs</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if it has been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the base blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the base blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the base blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the base blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if its ETag value matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if its ETag value matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if its ETag value does not match the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to snapshot the blob only if its ETag value does not match the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: If this header is specified, the operation will be performed only if both of the following conditions are met:
trans-unit.target: If this header is specified, the operation will be performed only if both of the following conditions are met:

trans-unit.source: The blob's lease is currently active.
trans-unit.target: The blob's lease is currently active.

trans-unit.source: The lease ID specified in the request matches that of the blob.
trans-unit.target: The lease ID specified in the request matches that of the blob.

trans-unit.source: If this header is specified and both of these conditions are not met, the request will fail and the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation will fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If this header is specified and both of these conditions are not met, the request will fail and the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation will fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.
trans-unit.target: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="36087161-9e7c-47e4-904c-3392cc35a8e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="36087161-9e7c-47e4-904c-3392cc35a8e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: This header returns a DateTime value that uniquely identifies the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: This header returns a DateTime value that uniquely identifies the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header indicates the snapshot version, and may be used in subsequent requests to access the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header indicates the snapshot version, and may be used in subsequent requests to access the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Note that this value is opaque.
trans-unit.target: Note that this value is opaque.

trans-unit.source: The ETag of the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The ETag of the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.
trans-unit.target: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

trans-unit.source: Note that a snapshot cannot be written to, so the ETag of a given snapshot will never change.
trans-unit.target: Note that a snapshot cannot be written to, so the ETag of a given snapshot will never change.

trans-unit.source: However, the ETag of the snapshot will differ from that of the base blob if new metadata was supplied with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snaphot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request.
trans-unit.target: However, the ETag of the snapshot will differ from that of the base blob if new metadata was supplied with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snaphot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request.

trans-unit.source: If no metadata was specified with the request, the ETag of the snapshot will be identical to that of the base blob at the time the snapshot was taken.
trans-unit.target: If no metadata was specified with the request, the ETag of the snapshot will be identical to that of the base blob at the time the snapshot was taken.

trans-unit.source: The last modified time of the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The last modified time of the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: The date format follows RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date format follows RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that a snapshot cannot be written to, so the last modified time of a given snapshot will never change.
trans-unit.target: Note that a snapshot cannot be written to, so the last modified time of a given snapshot will never change.

trans-unit.source: However, the last modified time of the snapshot will differ from that of the base blob if new metadata was supplied with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snaphot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request.
trans-unit.target: However, the last modified time of the snapshot will differ from that of the base blob if new metadata was supplied with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snaphot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request.

trans-unit.source: If no metadata was specified with the request, the last modified time of the snapshot will be identical to that of the base blob at the time the snapshot was taken.
trans-unit.target: If no metadata was specified with the request, the last modified time of the snapshot will be identical to that of the base blob at the time the snapshot was taken.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: Snapshots provide read-only versions of blobs.
trans-unit.target: Snapshots provide read-only versions of blobs.

trans-unit.source: Once a snapshot has been created, it can be read, copied, or deleted, but not modified.
trans-unit.target: Once a snapshot has been created, it can be read, copied, or deleted, but not modified.

trans-unit.source: A snapshot provides a convenient way to back up blob data.
trans-unit.target: A snapshot provides a convenient way to back up blob data.

trans-unit.source: You can use a snapshot to restore a blob to an earlier version by calling <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> to overwrite a base blob with its snapshot.
trans-unit.target: You can use a snapshot to restore a blob to an earlier version by calling <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> to overwrite a base blob with its snapshot.

trans-unit.source: When you create a snapshot, the Blob service returns a DateTime value that uniquely identifies the snapshot relative to its base blob.
trans-unit.target: When you create a snapshot, the Blob service returns a DateTime value that uniquely identifies the snapshot relative to its base blob.

trans-unit.source: You can use this value to perform further operations on the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: You can use this value to perform further operations on the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Note that you should treat this DateTime value as opaque.
trans-unit.target: Note that you should treat this DateTime value as opaque.

trans-unit.source: The DateTime value identifies the snapshot on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The DateTime value identifies the snapshot on the URI.

trans-unit.source: For example, a base blob and its snapshots have URIs similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: For example, a base blob and its snapshots have URIs similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Base blob:</embeddedLabel> <codeInline>http://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Base blob:</embeddedLabel> <codeInline>http://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Snapshot:</embeddedLabel> <codeInline>http://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Snapshot:</embeddedLabel> <codeInline>http://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Note that each time you call the <languageKeyword>Snapshot Blob</languageKeyword> operation, a new snapshot is created, with a unique DateTime value.
trans-unit.target: Note that each time you call the <languageKeyword>Snapshot Blob</languageKeyword> operation, a new snapshot is created, with a unique DateTime value.

trans-unit.source: A blob can support any number of snapshots.
trans-unit.target: A blob can support any number of snapshots.

trans-unit.source: Existing snapshots are never overwritten, but must be deleted explicitly by calling <link xlink:href="7f64072c-fcc6-4e7d-8653-5017dc8da7be" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Blob</link> and setting the <parameterReference>x-ms-include-snapshots</parameterReference> header to the appropriate value.
trans-unit.target: Existing snapshots are never overwritten, but must be deleted explicitly by calling <link xlink:href="7f64072c-fcc6-4e7d-8653-5017dc8da7be" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Blob</link> and setting the <parameterReference>x-ms-include-snapshots</parameterReference> header to the appropriate value.

trans-unit.source: Reading, Copying, and Deleting Snapshots
trans-unit.target: Reading, Copying, and Deleting Snapshots

trans-unit.source: A successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns a DateTime value in the <parameterReference>x-ms-snapshot</parameterReference> response header.
trans-unit.target: A successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns a DateTime value in the <parameterReference>x-ms-snapshot</parameterReference> response header.

trans-unit.source: You can then use this DateTime value to perform read, delete, or copy operations on a particular snapshot version.
trans-unit.target: You can then use this DateTime value to perform read, delete, or copy operations on a particular snapshot version.

trans-unit.source: Any Blob service operation that is valid for a snapshot can be called by specifying <parameterReference>?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> after the blob name.
trans-unit.target: Any Blob service operation that is valid for a snapshot can be called by specifying <parameterReference>?snapshot=%%amp;lt;DateTime%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> after the blob name.

trans-unit.source: Copying Blob Properties and Metadata
trans-unit.target: Copying Blob Properties and Metadata

trans-unit.source: When you create a snapshot of a blob, the following system properties are copied to the snapshot with the same values:
trans-unit.target: When you create a snapshot of a blob, the following system properties are copied to the snapshot with the same values:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-id</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-id</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-source</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-source</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-progress</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-progress</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-completion-time</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-completion-time</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status-description</parameterReference> (version 2012-02-12 and newer)

trans-unit.source: The base blob's committed block list is also copied to the snapshot, if the blob is a block blob.
trans-unit.target: The base blob's committed block list is also copied to the snapshot, if the blob is a block blob.

trans-unit.source: Any uncommitted blocks are not copied.
trans-unit.target: Any uncommitted blocks are not copied.

trans-unit.source: The snapshot blob is always the same size as the base blob at the time the snapshot is taken, so the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header for the snapshot blob will be the same as that for the base blob.
trans-unit.target: The snapshot blob is always the same size as the base blob at the time the snapshot is taken, so the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header for the snapshot blob will be the same as that for the base blob.

trans-unit.source: You can specify one or more new metadata values for the snapshot by specifying the <parameterReference>x-ms-meta-name:value</parameterReference> header on the request.
trans-unit.target: You can specify one or more new metadata values for the snapshot by specifying the <parameterReference>x-ms-meta-name:value</parameterReference> header on the request.

trans-unit.source: If this header is not specified, the metadata associated with the base blob is copied to the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: If this header is not specified, the metadata associated with the base blob is copied to the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Conditional Headers
trans-unit.target: Specifying Conditional Headers

trans-unit.source: You can specify conditional headers on the request to snapshot the blob only if a condition is met.
trans-unit.target: You can specify conditional headers on the request to snapshot the blob only if a condition is met.

trans-unit.source: If the specified condition is not met, the snapshot is not created, and the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed), along with additional error information about the unmet condition.
trans-unit.target: If the specified condition is not met, the snapshot is not created, and the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed), along with additional error information about the unmet condition.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Snapshot of a Leased Blob
trans-unit.target: Creating a Snapshot of a Leased Blob

trans-unit.source: If the base blob has an active lease, you can snapshot the blob as long as either of the following conditions are true of the request:
trans-unit.target: If the base blob has an active lease, you can snapshot the blob as long as either of the following conditions are true of the request:

trans-unit.source: The conditional <parameterReference>x-ms-lease-id</parameterReference> header is specified, and the active lease ID for the base blob is included in the request.
trans-unit.target: The conditional <parameterReference>x-ms-lease-id</parameterReference> header is specified, and the active lease ID for the base blob is included in the request.

trans-unit.source: This condition specifies that the snapshot be created only if the lease is active and the specified lease ID matches that associated with the blob.
trans-unit.target: This condition specifies that the snapshot be created only if the lease is active and the specified lease ID matches that associated with the blob.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>x-ms-lease-id</parameterReference> header is not specified at all, in which case the exclusive-write lease is ignored.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>x-ms-lease-id</parameterReference> header is not specified at all, in which case the exclusive-write lease is ignored.

trans-unit.source: Note that a lease associated with the base blob is not copied to the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: Note that a lease associated with the base blob is not copied to the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Snapshots cannot be leased.
trans-unit.target: Snapshots cannot be leased.

trans-unit.source: Copying Snapshots
trans-unit.target: Copying Snapshots

trans-unit.source: When a base blob is copied using the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation, any snapshots of the base blob are not copied to the destination blob.
trans-unit.target: When a base blob is copied using the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation, any snapshots of the base blob are not copied to the destination blob.

trans-unit.source: When a destination blob is overwritten with a copy, any snapshots associated with the destination blob stay intact under its name.
trans-unit.target: When a destination blob is overwritten with a copy, any snapshots associated with the destination blob stay intact under its name.

trans-unit.source: You can copy a snapshot blob over its base blob to restore an earlier version of a blob.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a snapshot blob over its base blob to restore an earlier version of a blob.

trans-unit.source: The snapshot remains, but the base blob is overwritten with a copy that can be both read and written.
trans-unit.target: The snapshot remains, but the base blob is overwritten with a copy that can be both read and written.

trans-unit.source: Promoting a snapshot in this way does not incur an additional charge for storage resources, since blocks or pages are shared between the snapshot and the base blob.
trans-unit.target: Promoting a snapshot in this way does not incur an additional charge for storage resources, since blocks or pages are shared between the snapshot and the base blob.

trans-unit.source: Snapshots in Premium Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Snapshots in Premium Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: There are a few differences between Azure Premium Storage accounts and standard storage accounts in terms of snapshots:
trans-unit.target: There are a few differences between Azure Premium Storage accounts and standard storage accounts in terms of snapshots:

trans-unit.source: The number of snapshots per page blob in a Premium Storage account is limited to 100.
trans-unit.target: The number of snapshots per page blob in a Premium Storage account is limited to 100.

trans-unit.source: If that limit is exceeded, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns error code 409 (SnapshotCountExceeded).
trans-unit.target: If that limit is exceeded, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns error code 409 (SnapshotCountExceeded).

trans-unit.source: A snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account may be taken once every ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: A snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account may be taken once every ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: If that rate is exceeded, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns error code 409 (SnaphotOperationRateExceeded).
trans-unit.target: If that rate is exceeded, the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Snapshot Blob</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns error code 409 (SnaphotOperationRateExceeded).

trans-unit.source: Reading a snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account via <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Reading a snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account via <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Calling <languageKeyword>Get Blob</languageKeyword> on a snapshot in a Premium Storage account returns error code 400 (Invalid Operation).
trans-unit.target: Calling <languageKeyword>Get Blob</languageKeyword> on a snapshot in a Premium Storage account returns error code 400 (Invalid Operation).

trans-unit.source: However, calling <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties</link> and <link xlink:href="17d768df-a804-45ba-b7f1-85ab5d79ec47" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Metadata</link> against a snapshot is supported.
trans-unit.target: However, calling <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties</link> and <link xlink:href="17d768df-a804-45ba-b7f1-85ab5d79ec47" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Metadata</link> against a snapshot is supported.

trans-unit.source: To read a snapshot, you can use the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation to copy a snapshot to another page blob in the account.
trans-unit.target: To read a snapshot, you can use the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation to copy a snapshot to another page blob in the account.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob for the copy operation must not have any existing snapshots.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob for the copy operation must not have any existing snapshots.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob does have snapshots, then <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> returns error code 409 (SnapshotsPresent).
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob does have snapshots, then <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> returns error code 409 (SnapshotsPresent).

trans-unit.source: For more information on calling REST operations on Azure Premium Storage resources, see <link xlink:href="e8bf5476-6a6f-4357-8c64-eb5e23e2905a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using Blob Service Operations with Azure Premium Storage</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on calling REST operations on Azure Premium Storage resources, see <link xlink:href="e8bf5476-6a6f-4357-8c64-eb5e23e2905a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using Blob Service Operations with Azure Premium Storage</link>.
